body:
Comment 1 by **so.peter.05**: 
"UTF-16 must specify byte-order for the byte serialization because it involves 16-bit
quantities. Byte order is the sole difference between UTF-16BE, in which the two bytes
of the 16-bit quantity are serialized in big-endian order, and UTF-16LE, in which they
are serialized in little-endian order."

5 Character Encoding Scheme (CES), UTR#17: Unicode Character Encoding Model
http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr17/#CharacterEncodingScheme
